intro: Euphorbia degeneri, commonly known as the Blue Euphorbia, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its compact, rounded shape and blue-gray foliage, which gives it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish-green cyathia, which are the modified flower structures typical of the Euphorbia genus. It is drought-tolerant and thrives in well-draining soil, making it suitable for rock gardens or arid environments. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its unique coloration and ability to store water in its thick leaves.
